articles.author: Clare Watson
articles.title: A Forgotten Continent From 40 Million Years Ago May Have Just Been Rediscovered - ScienceAlert
articles.description: A low-lying continent that existed some 40 million years ago and was home to exotic fauna may have "paved the way" for Asian mammals to colonize southern Europe, new research suggests.
articles.content:

articles.title: ESA's Solar Orbiter captures a huge eruption from the Sun - Daily Mail
articles.description: The burst of radiation erupted from the side of the Sun facing away from Earth and extended millions of miles into space, the European Space Agency said.
articles.content:
A huge eruption from the sun has been caught on camera by the European Space Agency's (ESA) Solar Orbiter probe.

articles.title: TM joins consortium to build new submarine cable system linking Southeast Asia, Middle East, and Western Europe - SoyaCincau.com
articles.description: The new SEA-ME-WE 6 cable will link Southeast Asia, Middle East and Western Europe and has a capacity of more than 100Tbps. The cable will land at TM's new cable landing station in Morib, which is close to hyperscalers' data centres.
